common-information.name: Sea Scallop Survey
common-information.title: Sea Scallop Survey
common-information.abstract: The standardized NEFSC Sea Scallop Survey began in 1980 and has covered an area from Cape Hatteras to Georges Bank. The survey aims to determine the distribution and abundance of scallops and associated fauna utilizing two sampling devices: the 8-foot wide New Bedford style dredge, standardized sea scallop dredge and the stereo-optic towed camera array (HabCam). Fifteen minute dredge hauls are made at stations that are randomly selected using the NEFSC shellfish strata to provide unbiased abundance measurements. The HabCam is conducted using transects across bathymetry lines in the same area as the dredge tows. Various vessels have served as a platform for the survey, including NOAA vessels: FRV Albatross IV, FRV Oregon II, FRV Chapman, FV Tradition and currently, the UNOLS vessel RV Hugh R. Sharp.
common-information.purpose: The NEFSC Sea Scallop Survey is an annual quantitative cruise to determine the distribution and abundance of scallops, Placopecten magellanicus, and Icelandic scallops, Chlamys islandica, and to characterize the associated fauna. There are three parts to the survey covering the following areas: Mid-Atlantic Bight/Southern New England, Southern New England/Georges Bank, and Georges Bank although coverage in earlier surveys spanned as far south as Cape Hatteras.
common-information.notes:
With the decommissioning of the FRV Albatross IV in 2008, the Sea Scallop Survey was transitioned to the UNOL's vessel, RV Hugh R. Sharp.
Since 2009, a habitat mapping camera system (HabCam) has been deployed. The camera system is towed by the vessel to a depth within one to two meters of the seafloor. Rapid photo streams (6 images per second) are sent to the ship over a fiber-optic cable, where they are recorded on large scale servers. This stream of images can later be stitched together to form a mosaic of the seafloor. Scientists on the ship see images and data while flying HabCam. Scallop measurements from the images are translated into a true size and biomass measurement. In addition, new software allows automated counting and measurement on the ship while the instrument is being towed.

theme-keywords.keyword-list: Atlantic sea scallop, Chlamys islandica, dredge, FRV Albatross IV, FRV Chapman, FRV Oregon II, FV Tradition, HabCam, Icelandic scallop, Placopecten magellanicus, rock chains, RV Hugh R. Sharp, stereo-optic towed vehicle

spatial-keywords.keyword-list: Georges Bank, Mid-Atlantic Bight, southern New England

geog-area.description: northwest Atlantic Ocean: Cape Hatteras, Delmarva Peninsula, Mid-Atlantic Bight, southern New England, Georges Bank

time-frame.description: The first scallop survey implementing a standard dredge, stratified random sampling design and covering a consistent area commenced on 05/20/1980.

access-info.data-access-constraints: If data is stored on an internal NEFSC network, the requester may not have direct access to query the data unless they are also authorized for network access.
access-info.data-access-procedure: 1. Formal request in writing usually to the data owner/contact or Center Director. 2. Requester is contacted by data owner to review and verify the request content and details for data delivery options. 3. If data is confidential then owner will determine is the data may be released to the requester. 4. If data can be released, the data is downloaded and packaged for delivery electronically; or the requester may be directed to where the data is available online.
access-info.data-use-constraints: User must read and fully comprehend the metadata prior to use. Applications or inferences derived from the data should be carefully considered for accuracy. Acknowledgement of NOAA/NMFS/NEFSC, as the source from which these data were obtained in any publications and/or other representations of these, data is suggested.

distribution.description:
Compressed Zipped Folders 22564_MasterTables.zip contains Entities - 22564_MASTER_CRUISE_DETAILS.csv - 22564_MASTER_CRUISE_TABLE.csv - 22564_SVDBS_CRUISES.csv 22564_FSCSTables.zip contains Entities - 22564_UNION_FSCS_SVBIO.csv - 22564_UNION_FSCS_SVCAT.csv - 22564_UNION_FSCS_SVLEN.csv - 22564_UNION_FSCS_SVSTA.csv
Data extracted on 8/23/2017

Compressed Zipped Folder contains Support Table Entities for this data set SVDBS_SupportTables.zip contains Entities - SVDBS_CLOUD.csv.csv - SVDBS_GEAR_CONDITION.csv - SVDBS_HAUL_VALUE.csv - SVDBS_MATURITY_CODES.csv - SVDBS_ SEX_CODES.csv - SVDBS_STATION_VALUE.csv - SVDBS_SVCRUISE_PURPOSE.csv - SVDBS_SVCRUISE_STATUS.csv - SVDBS_SVGEAR.csv - SVDBS_SVMSTRATA.csv - SVDBS_SV_VESSEL.csv - SVDBS_WEATHER.csv - SVDBS_XBT.csv
Data extracted on 8/8/2017

url.description: Link to the Atlantic Sea Scallop Survey Resource Survey Reports. The Resource Survey Reports consist of field notes, station and catch summaries, and a series of geographical plots of commercial and recreationally important species caught during the Ecosystem Surveys Branch's annual scallop resource cruise.

Link to the Atlantic Sea Scallop cruise results, which describe the purpose, methods used, personnel who participated, and a summary of the total number of samples collected for various government and university investigators.
Link to the University of Delaware, which provides information about the RV Hugh R. Sharp, the current scallop survey platform.
Link to the homepage of The FRV Albatross IV, which served as the scallop survey platform until 2007.
NOAA Fisheries Feature Story: HabCam Part I: An Innovative Way to Survey Scallop Habitat.
NOAA Fisheries Feature Story: HabCam Part II: A Closer Look at Our Science and Technology
Science Spotlight: New Survey of Ocean Floor Finds Juvenile Scallops are Abundant in Mid-Atlantic.

Serchuk, F.M., P.W. Wood, and R.S. Rak. 1982. Review and assessment of the Georges Bank, Mid-Atlantic and Gulf of Maine Atlantic sea scallop (Placopecten magellanicus) resources. U.S. Natl. Mar. Fish. Serv., Northeast Fish. Cent., Woods Hole Lab. Ref. Doc. 82-06. 132 p.

data-management.data-protection-plan: Archival of source data preserving unaltered collected data, Scheduled backups, Remote storage backups, Password protection.

lineage.lineage-statement:
Vessel sensor data are collected electronically using SCS. Station, catch and biological data were collected manually using paper logs until 2000. At the completion of each cruise leg, the logs were keypunched and data audited extensively prior to being released.
Starting with year 2001, FSCS 1.0 was implemented to electronically capture station, catch and biological data. Data were subject to extensive audits prior to being released.

entity.description: MASSACHUSETTS Child data table to MASTER_CRUISE_TABLE containing information related to all surveys conducted by or through the NEFSC.

attribute.name: SVVESSEL
attribute.description: Standard two character code for a survey vessel. Refer to SVDBS.SV_VESSEL

attribute.name: VESSEL_NUM
attribute.description: The nth consecutive number of a cruise on the given vessel in a year.

attribute.name: YEAR
attribute.description: Year in which cruise was conducted.

attribute.name: PURPOSE_CODE
attribute.description: Code referencing purpose of cruise conducted. See SVDBS.SVCRUISE_PURPOSE table

attribute.name: STATUS_CODE
attribute.description: Code referencing whether or not a cruise is available in the SVDBS system. See SVDBS.SVCRUISE_STATUS

attribute.name: CRUISE6
attribute.description: Code uniquely identifying cruise. The first four digits indicate the year and the last two digit uniquely identify the cruise within the year. The 5th byte signifies cruises other than groundfish: Shrimp survey = 7 (i.e. 201470), State of Massachusetts survey = 9 (i.e. 201491), Food habits = 5 (i.e.199554)

attribute.name: CRUISE
attribute.description: Unique numerical code for a cruise.

attribute.name: CRUISE_OLD
attribute.description: Code uniquely identifying a cruise or cruise component. CRUISE_OLD is used to idently the three-digit cruise code used before 1981, and match it to the newly assigned code found in the field CRUISE6. Prior to 1981, cruises were made up of four or more separate components based on geographic location of collected data. These components were assigned separate cruise codes, but were actually part of an entire bottom trawl survey. Therefore, there may be four or more separate cruise codes that make up one bottom trawl survey.

attribute.name: HISTORICAL_COMMENTS
attribute.description: Any comments related to the current cruise.

attribute.description: Date when record was inserted into Oracle. Date format (MM/DD/YY HH:MI:SS).

attribute.name: UOC

common-information.name: SEX_CODES
common-information.title: Table: SEX_CODES
common-information.abstract: Historical support table containing acceptable codes and descriptions for the field sex.

entity.description: Historical support table containing acceptable codes and descriptions for the field sex.

attribute.name: SEX
attribute.description: Code indicating sex of fish or invertebrate species. See SVDBS.FSCS_SEX_CODES if using fscs data and SVDBS.SEX_CODES if using non FSCS data. Codes 0, 1, 2 and 4 are the only valid codes in fscs tables.

attribute.name: SEX_DESCRIPTION
attribute.description: Description of the sex code field. Only 0, 1, 2 are valid entries for fscs tables. 0=Unsexed, unknown, or sex not observed; Since the summer 1995 Gulf of Maine Trawl Survey forgot to look for American Lobster; 1=Male; 2=Female; Female Stage I for Northern Shrimp; Since the summer 1995 Gulf of Maine Trawl Survey Female (no eggs, no notch) for American Lobster; 3=Female Stage II for Northern Shrimp; Since the summer 1995 Gulf of Maine Trawl Survey Female, with eggs, no notch for American Lobster; 4=Transitional for Northern Shrimp; Since the summer 1995 Gulf of Maine Trawl Survey Female, with notch, no eggs for American Lobster; 5=Ovigerous for Northern Shrimp; Since the summer 1995 Gulf of Maine Trawl Survey Female, with notch and eggs for American Lobster;6=Non-spawning Female for Northern Shrimp; 7=Female for Northern Shrimp not staged (stage I or II not determined)

attribute.name: STATION_TYPE

common-information.name: MASTER_CRUISE_TABLE
common-information.title: Table: MASTER_CRUISE_TABLE
common-information.abstract: Data table containing information related to all surveys conducted by or through the NEFSC.

entity.description: Data table containing information related to all surveys conducted by or through the NEFSC.

attribute.name: SVVESSEL
attribute.description: Standard two character code for a survey vessel. Refer to SVDBS.SV_VESSEL

attribute.name: VESSEL_NUM
attribute.description: The nth consecutive number of a cruise on the given vessel in a year.

attribute.name: YEAR
attribute.description: Year in which cruise was conducted.

attribute.name: PURPOSE_CODE
attribute.description: Code referencing purpose of cruise conducted. See SVDBS.SVCRUISE_PURPOSE table

attribute.name: STARTDATE
attribute.description: The date the vessel left the dock for the current cruise.

attribute.name: ENDDATE
attribute.description: Date the vessel returned to port.

attribute.name: SVGEAR
attribute.description: Code referencing predominant gear type used on a cruise. See SVDBS.SVGEAR table.

attribute.name: SEASON
attribute.description: Season of the year in which cruise was conducted.

attribute.name: ORIG_DATA_SHEETS
attribute.description: Code indicating whether or not original data sheets exist as scanned images. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist

attribute.name: SAIL_ORDERS_INSTR
attribute.description: Code indicating whether or not scanned images exist of the sailing orders and instructions for cruise. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist

attribute.name: CRUISE_RESULTS
attribute.description: Code indicating whether or not scanned images of cruise results exist. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist

attribute.name: TEMP_HYDRO_LOGS
attribute.description: Code indicating if scanned images exist of temperature and hydrography logs. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist

attribute.name: CRUISE_TRACKS
attribute.description: Code indicating whether scanned images of the cruise track exist. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist

attribute.name: CRUISE_NOTES_COMMENTS
attribute.description: Code indicating whether or not scanned images of notes and comments regarding cruise exist. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist.

attribute.name: PRESS_RELEASES
attribute.description: Code indicating whether or not press releases associated with cruise exist as scanned images. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist

attribute.name: SPECIES_SUMMARIES
attribute.description: Code indicating whether scanned images exist of species summaries. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist

attribute.name: ANCILLARY_STATION
attribute.description: Code indicating whether or not ancillary station data exist as scanned images. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist

attribute.name: CRUISE_PROBLEM_SHEETS
attribute.description: Code indicating whether scanned images of notes regarding problems encountered with data exist. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist.

attribute.name: STRATA_TOW_SHEETS
attribute.description: Code indicating whether scanned images of strata-tow sheets exist. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist

attribute.name: FISHERMEN_REPORTS
attribute.description: Code indicating existence of Fishermen reports as scanned images. 0=No digital images are available, 1=Scanned images exist

attribute.name: CRUISE_PICTURES
attribute.description: Code indicating whether scanned images exist relating to cruise. 0=No scanned images are available; 1=Scanned images exist

attribute.name: SCANMASTER_ID
attribute.description: Unique identification number of a record associated with scanned images in SVDBS.SVSCAN_IMAGES table

attribute.name: CRUISE_COMMENTS
attribute.description: Comments concerning cruise.

attribute.name: DOE
attribute.description: Date when record was inserted into Oracle. Date format (MM/DD/YY HH:MI:SS).

attribute.name: DOC
attribute.description: Date when the current record was updated or changed. Date format (MM/DD/YY HH:MI:SS)

common-information.name: SVMSTRATA
common-information.title: Table: SVMSTRATA
common-information.abstract: Historical support table containing all acceptable stratum codes.

entity.description: Historical support table containing all acceptable stratum codes.

attribute.name: STRGRP_DESC
attribute.description: Description of stratum group.

attribute.name: STRATUM
attribute.description: A predefined area where a net dredge, or other piece of gear was deployed. Code consists of 2 parts: Stratum group code number (2 bytes) and stratum number (3 bytes). Stratum group refers to if area fished is inshore or offshore North or South of Cape Hatteras or the type of cruise (shellfish, State of MA, offshore deepwater). The stratum number (third and fourth digits of code) refers to area defined by depth zone. See SVDBS.SVMSTRATA. The fifth digit of the code increases the length of the stratum number for revised strata after the Hague Line was established. Stratum group code: 01 = Trawl, offshore north of Hatteras; 02 = BIOM; 03 = Trawl, inshore north of Hatteras; 04 = Shrimp; 05 = Scotian shelf; 06 = Shellfish; 07 = Trawl, inshore south of Hatteras; 08 = Trawl, Offshore south of Hatteras; 09 = MA DMF; 99 = Offshore deepwater (outside the stratified area). A change in Bottom Trawl Stratum for the Gulf of Maine-Bay of Fundy has been in effect since Spring 1987, and may be summarized as follows: Previous strata: 01350; Present strata: 01351, 01352.

attribute.name: STRATUM_NAME
attribute.description: Name of stratum area.

attribute.name: STRATUM_AREA
attribute.description: Stratum area measured in square nautical miles.

attribute.name: MIDLAT
attribute.description: Middle latitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

attribute.name: MIDLON
attribute.description: Middle longitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

attribute.name: MINLAT
attribute.description: Minimum latitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

attribute.name: MAXLAT
attribute.description: Maximum latitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

attribute.name: MINLON
attribute.description: Minimum longitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

attribute.name: MAXLON
attribute.description: Maximum longitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

attribute.name: BLOCKS
attribute.description: Statistical area blocks.

attribute.name: NOTOWS
attribute.description: Number of tows for a given stratum.

attribute.name: DOE
attribute.description: Date when record was inserted into Oracle. Date format (MM/DD/YY HH:MI:SS).

attribute.name: DOC
attribute.description: Date when the current record was updated or changed. Date format (MM/DD/YY HH:MI:SS)

attribute.name: UOE
attribute.description: The Oracle username of the individual who entered the new record.

attribute.name: UOC
attribute.description: The Oracle username of the individual who changed the current record.

common-information.name: UNION_FSCS_SVBIO
common-information.title: Table: UNION_FSCS_SVBIO
common-information.abstract: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains individual fish and invertebrate data.

entity.description: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains individual fish and invertebrate data.

attribute.name: CRUISE6
attribute.description: Code uniquely identifying cruise. The first four digits indicate the year and the last two digit uniquely identify the cruise within the year. The 5th byte signifies cruises other than groundfish: Shrimp survey = 7 (i.e. 201470), State of Massachusetts survey = 9 (i.e. 201491), Food habits = 5 (i.e.199554)

attribute.name: CRUISE
attribute.description: Unique numerical code for a cruise.

attribute.name: STRATUM
attribute.description: A predefined area where a net dredge, or other piece of gear was deployed. Code consists of 2 parts: Stratum group code number (2 bytes) and stratum number (3 bytes). Stratum group refers to if area fished is inshore or offshore North or South of Cape Hatteras or the type of cruise (shellfish, State of MA, offshore deepwater). The stratum number (third and fourth digits of code) refers to area defined by depth zone. See SVDBS.SVMSTRATA. The fifth digit of the code increases the length of the stratum number for revised strata after the Hague Line was established. Stratum group code: 01 = Trawl, offshore north of Hatteras; 02 = BIOM; 03 = Trawl, inshore north of Hatteras; 04 = Shrimp; 05 = Scotian shelf; 06 = Shellfish; 07 = Trawl, inshore south of Hatteras; 08 = Trawl, Offshore south of Hatteras; 09 = MA DMF; 99 = Offshore deepwater (outside the stratified area). A change in Bottom Trawl Stratum for the Gulf of Maine-Bay of Fundy has been in effect since Spring 1987, and may be summarized as follows: Previous strata: 01350; Present strata: 01351, 01352.

attribute.name: TOW
attribute.description: Sequential number representing order in which station was selected within a stratum.

attribute.name: STATION
attribute.description: Unique sequential order in which stations have been completed. Hangups and short tows each receive a non-repeated consecutive number.

attribute.name: STATUS_CODE
attribute.description: Code referencing whether or not a cruise is available in the SVDBS system. See SVDBS.SVCRUISE_STATUS.

attribute.name: ID
attribute.description: Concatenation of Cruise, Stratum, Tow and Station values.

attribute.name: SVSPP
attribute.description: A standard code which represents a species caught in a trawl or dredge. Refer to the SVDBS.SVSPECIES_LIST

attribute.name: CATCHSEX
attribute.description: Code used to identify species that are sexed at the catch level. See SVDBS.SEX_CODES

attribute.name: INDID
attribute.description: A unique identifier for each fish sampled.

attribute.name: LENGTH
attribute.description: Measured length of species in centimeters (cm). Measure method differs by species.

attribute.name: INDWT
attribute.description: Individual weight (KG) of species being sampled.

attribute.name: SEX
attribute.description: Code indicating sex of fish or invertebrate species. See SVDBS.FSCS_SEX_CODES if using fscs data and SVDBS.SEX_CODES if using non FSCS data. Codes 0, 1, 2 and 4 are the only valid codes in fscs tables.

attribute.name: MATURITY
attribute.description: Stage of maturation of the fish being sampled. See SVDBS.FSCS_MATURITY_CODES

attribute.name: AGE
attribute.description: Age of specimen in years.

attribute.name: AGE_DATA_FLAG
attribute.description: Code to indicate whether or not an age sample was taken. Valuess: Y = Yes, sample taken; NULL = no age sample taken.

attribute.name: STOM_VOLUME
attribute.description: Volume of the stomach contents of the fish sampled, measured to the nearest tenth of a cubic centimeter (cc).

attribute.name: STOM_WGT
attribute.description: Stomach weight of an individual fish in grams.

attribute.name: CUTTER
attribute.description: Name of the individual who was measuring and cutting fish at a FSCS workstation.

attribute.name: RECORDER
attribute.description: The name of the individual who recorded data.

attribute.name: IND_FISH_COMMENTS
attribute.description: Comment field for an indiviual fish or invertebrate sampled.

common-information.name: UNION_FSCS_SVCAT
common-information.title: Table: UNION_FSCS_SVCAT
common-information.abstract: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains total number and weight of all species caught at a station.

entity.description: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains total number and weight of all species caught at a station.

attribute.name: CRUISE6
attribute.description: Code uniquely identifying cruise. The first four digits indicate the year and the last two digit uniquely identify the cruise within the year. The 5th byte signifies cruises other than groundfish: Shrimp survey = 7 (i.e. 201470), State of Massachusetts survey = 9 (i.e. 201491), Food habits = 5 (i.e.199554)

attribute.name: CRUISE
attribute.description: Unique numerical code for a cruise.

attribute.name: STRATUM
attribute.description: A predefined area where a net dredge, or other piece of gear was deployed. Code consists of 2 parts: Stratum group code number (2 bytes) and stratum number (3 bytes). Stratum group refers to if area fished is inshore or offshore North or South of Cape Hatteras or the type of cruise (shellfish, State of MA, offshore deepwater). The stratum number (third and fourth digits of code) refers to area defined by depth zone. See SVDBS.SVMSTRATA. The fifth digit of the code increases the length of the stratum number for revised strata after the Hague Line was established. Stratum group code: 01 = Trawl, offshore north of Hatteras; 02 = BIOM; 03 = Trawl, inshore north of Hatteras; 04 = Shrimp; 05 = Scotian shelf; 06 = Shellfish; 07 = Trawl, inshore south of Hatteras; 08 = Trawl, Offshore south of Hatteras; 09 = MA DMF; 99 = Offshore deepwater (outside the stratified area). A change in Bottom Trawl Stratum for the Gulf of Maine-Bay of Fundy has been in effect since Spring 1987, and may be summarized as follows: Previous strata: 01350; Present strata: 01351, 01352.

attribute.name: TOW
attribute.description: Sequential number representing order in which station was selected within a stratum.

attribute.name: STATION
attribute.description: Unique sequential order in which stations have been completed. Hangups and short tows each receive a non-repeated consecutive number.

attribute.name: STATUS_CODE
attribute.description: Code referencing whether or not a cruise is available in the SVDBS system. See SVDBS.SVCRUISE_STATUS.

attribute.name: ID
attribute.description: Concatenation of Cruise, Stratum, Tow and Station values.

attribute.name: SVSPP
attribute.description: A standard code which represents a species caught in a trawl or dredge. Refer to the SVDBS.SVSPECIES_LIST

attribute.name: CATCHSEX
attribute.description: Code used to identify species that are sexed at the catch level. See SVDBS.SEX_CODES

attribute.name: EXPCATCHNUM
attribute.description: Expanded number of individuals of a species caught at a given station.

attribute.name: EXPCATCHWT
attribute.description: Expanded catch weight of a species caught at a given station.

attribute.name: LOGGED_SPECIES_NAME
attribute.description: Name of the species, either common, scientific or both.

attribute.name: CATCH_COMMENT
attribute.description: Comments concerning a species at the catch level.

common-information.name: UNION_FSCS_SVLEN
common-information.title: Table: UNION_FSCS_SVLEN
common-information.abstract: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains total number of fish caught at each length for all species at a station.

entity.description: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains total number of fish caught at each length for all species at a station.

attribute.name: CRUISE6
attribute.description: Code uniquely identifying cruise. The first four digits indicate the year and the last two digit uniquely identify the cruise within the year. The 5th byte signifies cruises other than groundfish: Shrimp survey = 7 (i.e. 201470), State of Massachusetts survey = 9 (i.e. 201491), Food habits = 5 (i.e.199554)

attribute.name: CRUISE
attribute.description: Unique numerical code for a cruise.

attribute.name: STRATUM
attribute.description: A predefined area where a net dredge, or other piece of gear was deployed. Code consists of 2 parts: Stratum group code number (2 bytes) and stratum number (3 bytes). Stratum group refers to if area fished is inshore or offshore North or South of Cape Hatteras or the type of cruise (shellfish, State of MA, offshore deepwater). The stratum number (third and fourth digits of code) refers to area defined by depth zone. See SVDBS.SVMSTRATA. The fifth digit of the code increases the length of the stratum number for revised strata after the Hague Line was established. Stratum group code: 01 = Trawl, offshore north of Hatteras; 02 = BIOM; 03 = Trawl, inshore north of Hatteras; 04 = Shrimp; 05 = Scotian shelf; 06 = Shellfish; 07 = Trawl, inshore south of Hatteras; 08 = Trawl, Offshore south of Hatteras; 09 = MA DMF; 99 = Offshore deepwater (outside the stratified area). A change in Bottom Trawl Stratum for the Gulf of Maine-Bay of Fundy has been in effect since Spring 1987, and may be summarized as follows: Previous strata: 01350; Present strata: 01351, 01352.

attribute.name: TOW
attribute.description: Sequential number representing order in which station was selected within a stratum.

attribute.name: STATION
attribute.description: Unique sequential order in which stations have been completed. Hangups and short tows each receive a non-repeated consecutive number.

attribute.name: STATUS_CODE
attribute.description: Code referencing whether or not a cruise is available in the SVDBS system. See SVDBS.SVCRUISE_STATUS.

attribute.name: ID
attribute.description: Concatenation of Cruise, Stratum, Tow and Station values.

attribute.name: SVSPP
attribute.description: A standard code which represents a species caught in a trawl or dredge. Refer to the SVDBS.SVSPECIES_LIST

attribute.name: CATCHSEX
attribute.description: Code used to identify species that are sexed at the catch level. See SVDBS.SEX_CODES

attribute.name: LENGTH
attribute.description: Measured length of species in centimeters (cm). Measure method differs by species.

attribute.name: EXPNUMLEN
attribute.description: Expanded number of specimens at a given length.

attribute.name: LOGGED_SPECIES_NAME
attribute.description: Name of the species, either common, scientific or both.

attribute.name: LENGTH_COMMENT
attribute.description: Comment related to length of individual fish.

common-information.name: UNION_FSCS_SVSTA
common-information.title: Table: UNION_FSCS_SVSTA
common-information.abstract: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains station data for each station.

entity.description: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains station data for each station.

attribute.name: CRUISE6
attribute.description: Code uniquely identifying cruise. The first four digits indicate the year and the last two digit uniquely identify the cruise within the year. The 5th byte signifies cruises other than groundfish: Shrimp survey = 7 (i.e. 201470), State of Massachusetts survey = 9 (i.e. 201491), Food habits = 5 (i.e.199554)

attribute.name: CRUISE
attribute.description: Unique numerical code for a cruise.

attribute.name: STRATUM
attribute.description: A predefined area where a net dredge, or other piece of gear was deployed. Code consists of 2 parts: Stratum group code number (2 bytes) and stratum number (3 bytes). Stratum group refers to if area fished is inshore or offshore North or South of Cape Hatteras or the type of cruise (shellfish, State of MA, offshore deepwater). The stratum number (third and fourth digits of code) refers to area defined by depth zone. See SVDBS.SVMSTRATA. The fifth digit of the code increases the length of the stratum number for revised strata after the Hague Line was established. Stratum group code: 01 = Trawl, offshore north of Hatteras; 02 = BIOM; 03 = Trawl, inshore north of Hatteras; 04 = Shrimp; 05 = Scotian shelf; 06 = Shellfish; 07 = Trawl, inshore south of Hatteras; 08 = Trawl, Offshore south of Hatteras; 09 = MA DMF; 99 = Offshore deepwater (outside the stratified area). A change in Bottom Trawl Stratum for the Gulf of Maine-Bay of Fundy has been in effect since Spring 1987, and may be summarized as follows: Previous strata: 01350; Present strata: 01351, 01352.

attribute.name: TOW
attribute.description: Sequential number representing order in which station was selected within a stratum.

attribute.name: STATION
attribute.description: Unique sequential order in which stations have been completed. Hangups and short tows each receive a non-repeated consecutive number.

attribute.name: STATUS_CODE
attribute.description: Code referencing whether or not a cruise is available in the SVDBS system. See SVDBS.SVCRUISE_STATUS.

attribute.name: ID
attribute.description: Concatenation of Cruise, Stratum, Tow and Station values.

attribute.name: STATYPE
attribute.description: Code designating type of tow being performed (e.g. random vs. nonrandom tows). See SVDBS.STATION_VALUE table for all statype codes and their descriptions.

attribute.name: HAUL
attribute.description: Code for relative success of haul. See SVDBS.HAUL_VALUE table

attribute.name: GEARCOND
attribute.description: Refer to SVDBS.GEAR_CONDITION table for gear condition codes and descriptions.

attribute.name: SHG
attribute.description: Concatenation of Station, Haul and Gear values. See SVDBS.STATION_VALUE, SVDBS.HAUL_VALUE, SVDBS.GEAR_CONDITION

attribute.name: TYPE_CODE
attribute.description: Code concerning station details. This defines the type of sampling conducted at each station. Standard NEFSC BTS tows are coded with a T value = 1. The T value=1 is subdivided into 6 components: 1- Random Tow, within 1nm Radius; 1- Random Tow, outside 1nm, within 3nm Radius; 1- Repeat Tow; 1- Random Altername; 1- Random Offshore Continental Shelf; 1- Altername Offshore Protocol. Tow types other than NEFSC BTS standard random tows are defined by the following code values: 2- Non-Random Tow - Tow is not conducted according a random and stratified statistical design. Tow must follow NEFSC BTS protocols.; 3- Survey Standardization - Tow conducted to evaluate NEFSC BTS standardization (i.e. gear testing); 4- Comparison Tow - Tow conducted in comparison of other gears, surveys, vessels or operating procedures ; 5- Aborted Tow - Gear set but timed tow duration never started (aborted tow); 6- Site Specific - Non-random tow conducted in a specific, targeted region; 7- Experimental Survey Design - Survey design type other than random and stratified (i.e. transect, depletion study, grid, fixed etc.); 8 Other - Tows that do not fall into the previous categories. Detailed description of the tow type shall be recorded.

attribute.name: TYPE_COMMENT
attribute.description: Comment concerning the Type_Code of the given operation.

attribute.name: OPERATION_CODE
attribute.description: Code to define tow in terms of the operational characteristics (i.e. tow duration, vessel speed, scope ratio, depth, trawl perf., winch perf., stratum boundaries. O-Value= 4 is considered non-valid. Tow should be repeated, when possible, at the discretion of Chief Scientist. 1- Good Performance - All operational parameters are within optimal tol.range.2- Representative - Tow dur. 18.00min 19.49min or 20.50min-21.00min; 75-99% on-bottom tow dist. within the correct stratum; Door Spread mean outside optimal but within tol. limit. Wing Spread mean outside optimal but within tolerance limit. (Door and Wing spread are depth dependant calcs.); Headrope Height mean outside optimal but within the tolerance limit(Optimal Height is 3.2-4.1m.3- Representative - Tow dur. 16.00min -17.99min; Acqu. Code Value = 4 (details given with A code); Door Spread Std Deviation High (greater than 4.5m);Wing Spread Std Deviation High (> than 2.0m; Headrope Ht Spread Std Deviation High (Greater than 1.0m; Scope Ratio outside tolerance limit. (+/- 25%)4- Non Representative - Tow dur. < than 16.00min or > than 21.00min; Tow distance < than 0.8nm or > than 1.05nm; Door Spread mean outside tol. limit. (Depth dependant); Wing Spread mean outside tol. limit.(Depth dependant); Headrope Height mean outside tol. limit. (Less than 2.7m or greater than 4.7m); SOG mean outside tol. limit. (Less than 2.6 or greater than 3.4kts); Depth mean outside tol. limit. (EK6018kHz, must be within +/- 10% of set depth, or +/-5m at depths less than 50m); Mean Starboard and Mean Port Block Tension not equalized within ±0.5t; Diff. between mean Starboard and Port Winch calculated wire out lengths greater than 10m; Diff. between mean STBD and Port Block wire out lengths greater than 10m; Less than 75% of on-bottom tow distance within correct stratum; Trawl Depth > than 20% difference of vessel tow depth; Chief Scientist or Watch Chief Failed tow- tow considered unsatisfactory based on vessel or gear performance.

attribute.name: OPERATION_COMMENT
attribute.description: Comment concerning Operation Code of given operation (tow duration, vessel speed, scope ration, depth, trawl performance,winch performance, and stratum boundaries.

attribute.name: GEAR_CODE
attribute.description: Gear condition code.Gear defined as trawl net,cod-end,liner,sweep,doors & rigging. Valid Gear values =1,2,4(no code 3).1-Good Tow- No damage to webbing, frame ropes, sweep doors or rigging. Trawl properly rigged and considered to be in standard configuration. 2- Representative- Minor Small Holes/Tears in webbing (incl. cod-end and liner).Tears easily repaired coded 2. Larger holes/tears in Jibs,Wings,Bunts,Square or 1st & 2nd Top Bellies.Hole not thought to sig. alter fish capture.Obstr. in/on gear, not thought to signif. alter fish capture Minor Hang;No signif. gear damage;Hang,after 16.00min tow dur.;Tow dur. adjust to time hang occurred;Insignif. sweep damage (i.e. slight damage to rockhoppers not thought to increase fish escapement);Loss or damage to < than 12 floats; Very large catch;Deck tow of dogfish or other species;Other gear damage/malfunction not thought to significantly alter fish capture.4-Non_Representative -Signif. holes/tears/large holes in bottom bellies, or any portion of webbing aft of 2nd belly;Major Gear Damage(i.e. rim-rack, whole sections torn out,loss of trawl door(s) etc.);Open Cod-end;Improperly Attached Liner OR Open Liner OR Signif. Catch Outside Liner;Twisted Wing(s);Signif. Loss of bottom contacts (4min duration or longer).Improper Rigging;Collapsed Doors;Crossed Doors;Major Sweep Damage. (Parted sweep and/or major damage(i.e. loss of more than one rockhopper, or damage to sweep components thought to significantly increase fish escapement. Damaged Frame Rope(s)(headrope,up&down line,bolshline);Open Gore;Twisted or Crossed Bridle(s); Parted Legs;Loss/damage to 12 or > floats;Signif. damage to wing-end extension (i.e. loss, broken or altered length).Signif. Hang. Occurring at <16.00min tow dur.(OR unknown tow dur.;Large obstr. IN/ON gear thought to alter catch effic. or trawl geom.(i.e. pot stuck in front opening of cod-end. Catch not landed on deck;Damage to main towing cable(s);Other gear dam./malf. signif. altering catch efficiency.

attribute.name: GEAR_COMMENT
attribute.description: Comment concerning gear condition, damage or malfunction of a given operation.

attribute.name: ACQUISITION_CODE
attribute.description: Code concerning data acquisition (i.e. SCS data, trawl mens., SCS event button press).1- No Data Acq Errors. All data acq 75% or greater valid.2- Representative: Door Spread 50.00% - 74.99% data acq.;Wing Spread 50.00% - 74.99% data acq.;Height 50.00% - 74.99% data acq.;Trawl Depth 50.00% - 74.99% data acq.;Winch Tension 50.00% - 74.99% data acq.;Winch Wire Out 50.00% - 74.99% data acq.;Block Tension 50.00% - 74.99% data acq.;Block Wire Out 50.00% - 74.99% data acq.;Speed Over Ground 50.00% - 74.99% data acq.;Vessel Depth 50.00% - 74.99% data acq.;GPS 50.00% - 74.99% data acq.;3-Representative: Door Spread 25.00% - 49.99% data acq.;Wing Spread 25.00% - 49.99% data acq.;Height 25.00% - 49.99% data acq.;Trawl Depth 25.00% - 49.99% data acq.;Winch Tension 25.00% - 49.99% data acq.;Winch Wire Out 25.00% - 49.99% data acq.;Block Tension 25.00% - 49.99% data acq.;Block Wire Out 25.00% - 49.99% data acq.;Speed Over Ground 25.00% - 49.99% data acq.;Vessel Depth 25.00% - 49.99% data acq.;GPS 25.00% - 49.99% data acquisition.4- Non_Representative: Door Spread Less Than 25.00% data acq.;Wing Spread Less Than 25.00% data acq.;Height Less Than 25.00% data acq.;Trawl Depth Less Than 25.00% data acq.;Winch Tension Less Than 25.00% data acq.;Winch Wire Out Less Than 25.00% data acq.;Block Tension Less Than 25.00% data acq.;Block Wire Out Less Than 25.00% data acq.;Speed Over Ground Less Than 25.00% data acq.;Vessel Depth Less Than 25.00% data acq.;GPS Less Than 25.00% data acq.;Error Recording Event Data. Trawl event data missing.;Critical Button Press Error, Unknown Event Time(s).

attribute.name: ACQUISITION_COMMENT
attribute.description: Comment concerning data acquisition (i.e. SCS data, trawl mensuration, SCS event button press).

attribute.name: TOGA
attribute.description: A concatentation of the T, O, G and A codes assigned to an operation. Each standard survey tow is evaluated based on four categories, Type, Operational, Gear and Acquisition (T.O.G.A.). Type (T), Operational (O) and Gear (G) categories are used to validate each tow; the Acquisition (A) category is additional information not used for validation. T.O.G.A. is a detailed analysis of survey trawl and vessel performance during each tow, utilizing available data from trawl mensuration systems and vessel sensors not previously analyzed by the historical Station, Haul, and Gear (S.H.G.) coding system.

attribute.name: AREA
attribute.description: Standard area code used for commercial data (New England Statistical Area Code) for the position of the beginning of the tow.

attribute.name: SVVESSEL
attribute.description: Standard two character code for a survey vessel. Refer to SVDBS.SV_VESSEL

attribute.name: CRUNUM
attribute.description: National Ocean Services (NOS) consecutive cruise number on a particular vessel.

attribute.name: SVGEAR
attribute.description: Code referencing predominant gear type used on a cruise. See SVDBS.SVGEAR table.

attribute.name: BEGIN_EST_TOWDATE
attribute.description: Date and time represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST) for the start of a tow or deployment.

attribute.name: END_EST_TOWDATE
attribute.description: Date and time represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST) at the end of a tow or deployment.

attribute.name: BEGIN_GMT_TOWDATE
attribute.description: Date and time represented by Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) for the start of a tow or deployment.

attribute.name: END_GMT_TOWDATE
attribute.description: Date and time represented by Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) at the end of a tow or deployment.

attribute.name: EST_YEAR
attribute.description: Year, represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST).

attribute.name: EST_MONTH
attribute.description: Month, represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST).

attribute.name: EST_DAY
attribute.description: Day of the month represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST).

attribute.name: EST_JULIAN_DAY
attribute.description: Julian day of towdate represented as Eastern Standard Time (EST).

attribute.name: EST_TIME
attribute.description: Time, represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST).

attribute.name: GMT_YEAR
attribute.description: Year, represented as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

attribute.name: GMT_MONTH
attribute.description: Month, represented as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

attribute.name: GMT_DAY
attribute.description: Day of the month, represented as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

attribute.name: GMT_JULIAN_DAY
attribute.description: Julian day of towdate represented as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

attribute.name: GMT_TIME
attribute.description: Time, represented as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

attribute.name: TOWDUR
attribute.description: Duration of tow in minutes.

attribute.name: SETDEPTH
attribute.description: Depth at the time the primary gear is set to fish, to the nearest meter.

attribute.name: ENDDEPTH
attribute.description: Water depth (m) at end of tow.

attribute.name: MINDEPTH
attribute.description: Minimum depth (m) at which gear fished.

attribute.name: MAXDEPTH
attribute.description: Maximum depth at which gear fished.

attribute.name: AVGDEPTH
attribute.description: A four digit number recording the average depth, to the nearest meter, during a survey gear deployment.

attribute.name: BEGEKVLOG
attribute.description: An eight digit number measuring to the nearest thousandth of a nautical mile (e.g., 14564.345). Used to mark the beginning of a survey trawl for acoustic data purposes.

attribute.name: ENDEKVLOG
attribute.description: An eight digit number measuring to the nearest thousandth of a nautical mile (e.g., 14564.345). Used to mark the end of a survey trawl for acoustic data purposes.

attribute.name: BEGLAT
attribute.description: Beginning latitude of tow (decimal degrees).

attribute.name: BEGLON
attribute.description: Beginning longitude of tow (decimal degrees).

attribute.name: ENDLAT
attribute.description: Latitude at end of tow.

attribute.name: ENDLON
attribute.description: Logitude at end of tow.

common-information.name: SVDBS_CRUISES
common-information.title: View: SVDBS_CRUISES
common-information.abstract: Data view conatining unique records for each cruise conducted by or through the NEFSC

entity.description: Data view conatining unique records for each cruise conducted by or through the NEFSC

attribute.name: CRUISE6
attribute.description: Code uniquely identifying cruise. The first four digits indicate the year and the last two digit uniquely identify the cruise within the year. The 5th byte signifies cruises other than groundfish: Shrimp survey = 7 (i.e. 201470), State of Massachusetts survey = 9 (i.e. 201491), Food habits = 5 (i.e.199554)

attribute.name: PURPOSE_CODE
attribute.description: Code referencing purpose of cruise conducted. See SVDBS.SVCRUISE_PURPOSE table

attribute.name: PURPOSE
attribute.description: Description of purpose_code to identify type of cruise conducted (e.g. Bottom Trawl, Scallop, Clam, etc.)

attribute.name: STATUS_CODE
attribute.description: Code referencing whether or not a cruise is available in the SVDBS system. See SVDBS.SVCRUISE_STATUS

attribute.name: STATUS
attribute.description: A data status code indictating whether a cruise is availabe in SVDBS system. See SVDBS.SVCRUISE_STATUS

attribute.name: SEASON
attribute.description: Season of the year in which cruise was conducted

attribute.name: YEAR
attribute.description: Year in which cruise was conducted
